intro: Schefflera sararensis, commonly known as the Sararensis umbrella plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, compound leaves that resemble an umbrella. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in umbellate inflorescences, and it produces dark blue berries that are edible for some bird species. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
